speaker: Frasier
text: In the greater Seattle area, the number is 555-KACL.  We've got a number of lines open, so please give us a call. [_to Roz_] Now who's up next, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Pam on line four.  She's having a problem with her family.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_presses a button_] Hello, Pam.  This is Dr Frasier Crane; I'm listening.

speaker: Pam
text: [_v.o._] Hi.  It's my in-laws.  It's just that, well... they drop over all the time without calling first, and they expect us to stop what we're doing and entertain them.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, they're your husband's parents - what does he suggest?

speaker: Pam
text: [_v.o._] The other day, he had us drop to the floor and stay quiet until they drove away.

speaker: Frasier
text: A creative approach, but hardly a long-term solution.

speaker: Pam
text: [_v.o._] Well I, I thought about saying something, but I'm afraid I'll hurt their feelings.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then you have a choice.  Either you risk hurting their feelings, or you spend the rest of your life diving for cover whenever they happen to drop on by...

speaker: Pam
text: [_v.o.; whispering_] Shhh!  They're here!

speaker: Frasier
text: Who... your in-laws?

speaker: Pam
text: [_v.o._] Shh!  Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispering_] Well then, why don't you just take this opportunity to... [_stops whispering_] Oh, for pete's sake! Why don't you just tell them how you feel?

speaker: Pam
text: [_v.o.; whispering_] Okay!  Okay, I will next time, I promise! Thanks, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes... ah, well, as, er, [_presses a button_] Pam belly- crawls across her living room, let's take a moment for this message from... [_checks the copy_] "Carpet Fresh."

speaker: Frasier
text: How's that for a segue? [_laughs_]  **HOW MANY SHARKS DIED...?**  _Scene Two - Frasier's apartment. Daphne is standing at the dinner table, sorting some laundry. Frasier and Martin, returning from a shopping trip, enter from the front door._

speaker: Frasier
text: I just don't think it's very smart to make rude gestures at other drivers!

speaker: Martin
text: He cut you off!

speaker: Frasier
text: That doesn't matter!  You, you do not antagonize a man whose bumper sticker says, "If you're close enough to read this, I'll kill you!"

speaker: Martin
text: Big talk from a Volvo.

speaker: Daphne
text: I see you've found yourself a new suit.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, wait till you see it, Daph - it's a beaut!

speaker: Daphne
text: Let's have a look!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, can't let you see it on the hanger; I'll model it for you!  _He leaves for his room.  Daphne picks up a pair of "knickers" and begins to flap them vigorously._

speaker: Daphne
text: What a nice son you are, buying your father a new suit.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it didn't quite work out the way I planned, but er... [_notices_] Daphne, what are you doing?

speaker: Daphne
text: Fluffing your knickers.  If you don't mind my saying so, you're losing some of your elasticity.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I appreciate everything you're doing, Daphne, [_takes them_] but a man's knickers are certainly... [_feels them; surprised_] Ooh... [_presses them against his face_] How'd you get them so... soft?

speaker: Daphne
text: Fabric softener [_takes the knickers from him_] and twice through the fluff cycle. [_continues "fluffing"_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well keep up the good work! [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on the phone_] Hello?  Yes.  Well, hi Niles.  Well, of course you can come by!  Great!  I'll, I'll see you there!  _Frasier puts the phone down and goes to the door.  He opens it: it is Niles, and he has just finished using his mobile phone._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi Niles, good to see you!   [_N.B. After this episode, it may be a LONG time before Niles thinks to call before dropping by._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks for calling first.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I heard your show today.  I wouldn't dream of popping by unannounced.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah...

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, I was in the neighborhood, and I've come to beg a favor.  Er, my housekeeper Mary is a very big fan of your little radio program.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pleased_] Is she?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Well, what she lacks in taste, she makes up for in vigor. [_puts his briefcase down_] She'd like an autographed photo.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, it'd be my pleasure. [_to Daphne_] Daphne, this is my brother Niles. [_leaves to get the photo_]  _Niles sees Daphne for the first time, and is pleasantly surprised, to say the least.  Daphne just smiles at him._

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm... you're Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Why, yes I am.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I...  _Niles goes over to her eagerly, and they shake hands; he holds on, a little lost for words._

speaker: Niles
text: When Frasier told me he'd hired an Englishwoman, I pictured someone a little more... not quite so... you're Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's nice to meet you.  _She takes her hand away and gets back to sorting the laundry. Frasier returns with a photo._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what a lovely accent.  Is that, er, Manchester?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes.  How'd you know?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, ha!  I'm quite the anglophile; I'm sure Frasier and dad have already told you.  _Frasier sits on the couch, preparing to sign the photo.  Niles, still enraptured by Daphne, absent-mindedly picks up a pair of Frasier's knickers._

speaker: Daphne
text: No, they didn't mention it.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah... you undoubtedly guessed as much when they said I'd spent a year studying at Cambridge.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, they didn't mention that, either.

speaker: Niles
text: I guess my father and brother don't spend a lot of time talking about me when I'm not around! [_starts to feel the knickers_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I wouldn't say that...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gets up, having signed the photo_] Niles, here's your picture...

speaker: Frasier
text: DO YOU _MIND?!_  _He grabs the pair of knickers from Niles and throws them back onto the dinner table.  While he glowers, Niles takes the photo and walks over to his briefcase._

speaker: Niles
text: [_reads_] "Mary, here's wishing you good mental health: Frasier Crane."  _Niles puts the photo in his briefcase.  Martin returns, wearing his new suit; it is an odd, dark red or brown color and looks distinctly cheap._

speaker: Martin
text: Fits like a glove.  Hi, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, dad... [_notices his suit_] Wow.

speaker: Martin
text: How do I look?

speaker: Niles
text: Wow.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Niles_] Dr. Crane took your father shopping to Armani this afternoon.

speaker: Niles
text: [_incredulous_] You got that at Armani?

speaker: Martin
text: Just like I told you, Frasier - he can't tell the difference!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we were on our way to Armani, when dad spotted this in the window of a discount clothing store.

speaker: Martin
text: It's sharkskin! [_waves his forearm_] Look at the way it changes color when I move my arm!  _Niles stares at him, less than impressed.  Daphne, carrying the laundry, goes over to Martin._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Martin_] You're going to be the handsomest gent at your friend's retirement party.  Now come on, let's go and hang it up before it gets wrinkled.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's supposed to resist wrinkles.  They had one in the display window winded up inside a mayonnaise jar!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, is he our real father?

speaker: Frasier
text: Now don't start that again - we've been having this discussion since we were children.

speaker: Niles
text: [_goes towards the kitchen_] But that suit!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well it's not just the suit, it's, it's his taste in everything!  Clothing, films, music...  _Reset to the kitchen.  Niles has just entered and goes about making himself a drink.  Frasier enters._

speaker: Niles
text: Outside of our last name and abnormally well-developed calf muscles, we have nothing in common with the man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank goodness we took after mum.

speaker: Niles
text: So how come he didn't acquire any of her... sophistication?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe he was too busy working his tail off so that we could have the nicer things.

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know Niles, maybe it's time we tried to pay him back in some way.  Expose him to some of the finer things, so that he'd stop lumbering through life like some great polyester dinosaur.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know.  Dad's so set in his ways.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we all are at some point in our lives.  Remember when you used to think the 1812 Overture was a great piece of classical music?

speaker: Niles
text: [_shakes his head wistfully_] Was I ever that young?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you and I have to broaden dad's horizons.  Show him the world that he's only read about in TV Guide.

speaker: Niles
text: How about an evening of fine dining?

speaker: Frasier
text: Perfect... but where? **Frasier & Niles: **[_excited_] Le Cigare Volant!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_ecstatic, wrings his hands_] Hah!

speaker: Niles
text: [_suddenly calm_] But can we really get in?  I've been trying for months.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, puh-leeze.  Niles, you're forgetting the cache my name carries in this town.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, I'm not.  If the maitre d' happens to be a housewife, we're in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you are so mean.  _Frasier leaves the kitchen, with Niles following.  Reset to outside the kitchen._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll just call information.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no need; I have it on speed dial.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Thank you. [_on Niles's phone_] Hello, this is Dr Frasier Crane.  Yes, the one on the radio. [_looks at Niles, triumphantly_] Say... any chance of, er, getting a table for four on Saturday at er, say... eight, hmm?  _Merci, a bient�t_! [_shuts Niles's phone, laughs_] We're in!

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, can I get you a beer?  Some pork rinds?

speaker: Niles
text: [_rubs his sore post-high-five hand_] No thanks.  Em...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Niles and I and Maris would like you to join us for dinner on Saturday night at, _Le Cigare Volante_ - it's one of the hottest new restaurants in town.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, gee, I don't know, I...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh-oh-oh, the food is to die for!

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, your country and your family are to die for; food is to eat. [_sits in The Armchair_] Look, I appreciate the offer, but I wouldn't like it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dad, how do you know if you don't try it?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I didn't have to get shot in the hip with a .38 to know I wouldn't like that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but, dad, it'll give us a chance to have an evening all together as a family.  You know, Niles and I _really_ want to do this for you.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh... alright.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] We're gonna have the best time!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey - it'll give me a chance to wear my new suit again, too!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] And won't that be nice?  **HONEY, DON'T**  _Scene Three: KACL; Roz's booth, before show time. Roz is doing some administrative stuff, and Frasier is sipping a coffee._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, how do the calls look today?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, we've got a couple of jilted lovers, a man who's afraid of his car, a manic depressive, and three people who feel their lives are going nowhere.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I love a Monday.  So how was your weekend?

speaker: Roz
text: I had the most hellacious date of my life.  First, he asks me to pick him up from work.  Then, I stop for gas - I have to pump it myself while he just sits there reading the sports section.  So I take him back to my place and make him my famous sweet and sour shrimp; I'm in the middle of cooking, I ask him to hand me the honey, and he gets this freaked-out look on his face and says he can't because he has a deathly fear of touching anything sticky.

speaker: Roz
text: I told him it was a new jar, but he didn't want to take any risks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, where do you meet these people?

speaker: Roz
text: [_indignant_] I answered his ad! [_gestures towards the studio_] You got thirty seconds - you'd better get in there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not yet.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, no...

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, are you ready?

speaker: Roz
text: [_reluctant_] Don't make me do this...

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, we do this every Monday!

speaker: Roz
text: _You_ do this every Monday.  I play along!

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_enthusiastic_] Who's got the best talk show in Seattle?

speaker: Roz
text: [_waves the paper around like a half-hearted cheerleader_] We do.  We do.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shakes his fist_] Alright!   **DINNER AT EIGHT**  _Scene Four: Frasier's apartment. Eddie is asleep on the couch.  The balcony doors are open; the sound of traffic and other city noises can be heard.  A snazzily-suited Frasier, holding a glass of sherry, returns from the balcony and shuts the doors.  Daphne enters from her room._

speaker: Daphne
text: We-ell!  Aren't you a bobby dazzler?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll go out on a limb and take that as a compliment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Where are you off to?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm going to poker night.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wouldn't have pegged you as a card player.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's mostly social.  Me and the girls just bumping the gums.  No-one ever loses more than five or six hundred dollars.  _Frasier opens the door.  It is Niles; he is carrying a small paper bag and looks somewhat excitable._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello. [_enters_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Where's Maris?  Are you two taking separate elevators again?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no.  I'm afraid Maris is having one of her episodes.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_closes the door_] Ah...

speaker: Niles
text: In the middle of dressing for the evening, she suddenly slumped down on the edge of the bed in her half-slip and sighed.  Course, I knew then and there that dinner was not to be.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry. [_comforts Niles_]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, I'll just have to make the best of it... [_strides over to Daphne_] Hi-ho, Daphne, you're looking luminous this evening!

speaker: Daphne
text: Why thank you, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] What's in the bag?

speaker: Niles
text: Er, just a little treat I picked up for dad: some Devonshire Clotted Cream.

speaker: Frasier
text: For... dad?

speaker: Daphne
text: I love Devonshire Clotted Cream.

speaker: Niles
text: Isn't that lucky - you two can share it. [_gives the bag to her_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll just go and pop this in the fridge.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sherry, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  _Frasier goes to get the sherry.  Niles is still gazing off-screen after Daphne._

speaker: Niles
text: I'm having a thought, Frasier.  Since Maris has sadly dropped out and we do have an extra space, perhaps we should invite Daphne to join us for the evening.  I mean, it is a table for four and, and three is such an awkward number, you know, at a, at a dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: Nothing, nothing... [_realizes_] Oh, for goodness sake, Frasier! I'm a happily married man!  Maris means the world to me.  Why, just the other day I kissed her for no reason whatsoever.  _He is about to sit down on the couch when he sees that Daphne has returned._

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm off to my poker game. [_to Niles_] It was nice seeing you again, Dr. Crane...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, wait a minute!  I'm getting something on you...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] She's psychic.  We've decided to find it charming.

speaker: Daphne
text: You have occasional bouts of colitis, don't you?

speaker: Niles
text: [_entranced_] Yes!  _Daphne takes her hand away and goes to the door.  Niles can't keep his eyes off her._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier...she's phenomenal!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_at the door_] It's a gift.  Well, cheerio!

speaker: Niles
text: Ta-ta!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you've never had colitis a day in your life!

speaker: Niles
text: I know, but I couldn't bear to disappoint her...

speaker: Martin
text: 'Kay!  I'm ready to go!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, ah, dad, what's happened to your suit?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's at the cleaners.  I got some creamed chicken on it at Phil's retirement dinner last night.  You can't keep anything nice.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, well, I-I-I-I'm sure the _Cigare Volante_ has a dress code...

speaker: Frasier
text: Er Niles, may I borrow your phone?

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you so much.

speaker: Martin
text: Where's Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: Episode.

speaker: Martin
text: [_unsurprised_] Oh.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on phone_] Yes hello, this is Dr Frasier Crane; I have a reservation tonight.  I'm calling to enquire about your, minimum dress code. [_worried_] Crane.  Frasier.  Doctor! [_very worried_] Well, what do you... we've had the reservation for over a week! [_off the phone, angry_] They've lost our reservation.

speaker: Niles
text: Give me that. [_takes the phone_] Listen, this is Dr. _Niles_ Crane. I've never been treated so shabbily in my entire life and I've a good mind to come over there and create an embarrassing scene.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, they've already hung up.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah... thank God! [_closes his phone and pockets it_] Well, what now, Frasier?  It's Saturday night, quarter-to-eight, and we-we're not going to get in anywhere.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I know!  Why don't I take us all to The Timber Mill?

speaker: Niles
text: The... Timber Mill?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's great!  You can get a steak this thick for eight- ninety-five! [_indicates a brick-like thickness_]

speaker: Niles
text: Ah... honestly, dad, that doesn't sound like the kind of restaurant we'd like.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I was willing to go to your place.

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, dad, I I think we'd better just er, take a rain check.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh gee, I was looking forward to spending an evening with you boys.  But we can do it some other time. [_sad_] I'm sure Daphne's got something in the fridge I can heat up...  _He slowly hobbles over to the kitchen.  Frasier and Niles watch him guiltily._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_suddenly upbeat_] You know, on second thoughts I'm, I'm really in the mood for a good steak!

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Frasier_] What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well yes, you know, the point of the whole thing is not exactly where we have dinner, but that the three of us have an evening together as a family!  Right?

speaker: Martin
text: [_excited_] Ah, you won't be sorry!  They've got five different toppings for your baked potato!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ooh, did you hear that, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sold!

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Eddie_] We'll bring you a bone, Eddie!

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Frasier and Niles_] He's ecstatic.  _End of Act One.  Act Two._  **TIM-BERRR!**  _Scene One: The Timber Mill. A lively American restaurant with a homely, informal atmosphere. The staff are dressed in "country" garb and are serving what looks like an (almost) full house.  Martin, Frasier and Niles enter.  Martin looks very at home; his sons, however, are conspicuous both in their expensive suits and the disdainful attitude with which they regard the place._

speaker: Martin
text: Quite a place, huh?  Used to be a real working saw-mill!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] Until somebody stated the obvious and said: "Hey, let's turn this place into a restaurant!"

speaker: Martin
text: I just walk in here and my mouth starts watering.  There's nothing like the smell of charbroiled meat.

speaker: Niles
text: This aroma's triggering a, a sense memory.  Something familiar.  It... oh, of course, Maris in her home tanning bed.

speaker: Hostess
text: Hi!  Welcome to The Timber Mill.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_not without trepidation_] You don't have a table for three... do you?

speaker: Hostess
text: Sure, right this way.

speaker: Hostess
text: Is this your first visit to The Timber Mill?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Hostess
text: Well, we've got a dress code.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_worried_] Oh well, couldn't you make an exception in this case? [_gestures at Martin_] His suit was at the cleaners-

speaker: Hostess
text: Er, not him.  You.  _She suddenly produces a big pair of scissors and snips off Frasier's tie below the knot; another waitress does the same to Niles._

speaker: Hostess
text: [_shouts_] _Tim-berrr_!  _The other diners in the restaurant clap, cheer, and clang their cutlery.  Frasier and Niles are in shock; Martin has been watching this "initiation ceremony" with amusement.  The waitresses place their severed ties on what is now clearly a wall of dismembered cravates behind the counter._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_distraught_] My tie!  She, she cut off my tie!

speaker: Martin
text: Gotcha!  Ain't that great?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, why did she cut off my tie?!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, they've been doing it for years!  They like to keep the place casual.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, you could have mentioned that to us.

speaker: Martin
text: What, and spoil the fun? [_laughs_] Ah, cheer up!  You get a free dessert!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, boy. [_calms down a bit_] Well, I guess you're right, dad; it's just a tie...

speaker: Niles
text: A Hugo Boss tie.  _They sit down: Frasier on the left, Niles on the right, and Martin between them.  Niles, of course, obsessively cleans his chair beforehand.  A lively waitress arrives with bread slices and butter._

speaker: Waitress
text: Hi, can I get you guys something from the bar?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_weary_] Oh dear God, yes.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll have a Stoli Gibson on the rocks, with three pearl onions.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_firmly_] If you bring him two, if you bring him four - he'll send it back.

speaker: Waitress
text: And for you?

speaker: Frasier
text: The same.

speaker: Martin
text: I'll have a Ballantine.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Frasier_] Say, funny thing happened the other day: one of my patients had a rather amusing Freudian slip.  He was having dinner with his wife, and he meant to say, "pass the salt," but instead he said, "You've ruined my life, you blood-sucking shrew."

speaker: Martin
text: Bet she didn't like that.

speaker: Niles
text: N-no, no dad, she didn't. [_to Martin_] Say, how was your buddy's retirement party last night?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it was great.  You know, I really miss those guys.  Bad news, though.  Remember Mo Hanson?  The desk captain of my old precinct?  Killed in a boating accident.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  Well, at least he went quick.  Hank Grinsky - well, he had three bypasses before he went.  _Despite this, Martin has smeared an unhealthily large amount of butter onto his bit of bread._

speaker: Martin
text: Jimmy Bourbon, he had this weird disease.  I went to visit him in the hospital; by the time he died, his skin was all yellow, wasted away to nothing.  Nice nurse, though -- Betty, I think her name was.  _He pops the cholesterol-mungous bit of bread into his mouth, not noticing that Frasier and Niles have become somewhat uncomfortable with his choice of topic.  The waitress arrives with their drinks._

speaker: Waitress
text: I see we have a couple of first-timers here!  Let me tell you how it works.  Every entree comes with soup or a trip to the salad bar: one trip only, please!  Also included is our famous garlic cheese bread.  _A man pulls up a chunky wooden trolley in front of the table.  Upon it are heaped various multicoloured, brick-thick slabs of raw flesh._

speaker: Waitress
text: And now if you're ready, you can claim your steaks.

speaker: Niles
text: Claim our steaks...?

speaker: Martin
text: [_points_] You get to pick the cut you want off the beef trolley!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hesitant_] How much extra would I have to pay to get one from the refrigerator?

speaker: Martin
text: [_annoyed_] Would you just pick your steak?

speaker: Niles
text: I'll, I'd like a, a petite filet mignon, very lean - not so lean that it lacks flavour, but not so fat that it leaves drippings on the plate.  And I don't want it cooked - just lightly seared on either side, pink in the middle; not a true pink, but not a mauve either, something in between. Bearing in mind the slightest error either way, and it's ruined.

speaker: Waitress
text: ...Okay! [_to Frasier_] How about you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Could I see the other side of that one? [_points queasily at a steak_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_gestures at the trolley_] Just bring us those three: medium-rare, all the 'fixins.

speaker: Martin
text: [_excited_] Hey, come on!  There's a lull at the salad bar!  _Martin gets up.  Frasier looks resigned; Niles covers his eyes with his hand.  Fade to black._  _Scene Two: The Timber Mill, later. They are halfway through their salads when a waiter takes away their plates._

speaker: Martin
text: Isn't this great?  They have the best Thousand Island Dressing in town.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, dad, I saw the plaque by the cash register.  _The waitress arrives with their main courses: steaks, baked potatoes with toppings, and other assorted bits._

speaker: Waitress
text: Here we go: three boiled onions, medium-rare!

speaker: Frasier
text: Wha-?  We've barely touched our salads!

speaker: Martin
text: Great service, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  With any luck we should be completing our dining experience in less than twenty minutes.

speaker: Waitress
text: If you're not ready I could put this under the heat lamp...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, no-no, that won't be necessary young lady, I'm as ready as I'll ever be...

speaker: Waitress
text: Alright.  Let me know if I can get you anything else.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to her back, sarcastic_] Yes, thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, I don't mind you guys being tough on this place, but you could be a little nicer to the waitress.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right.  I'll apologize when she comes with the dessert.  Which should be any time now.  _They begin to eat.  Or at least Martin does.  Frasier chews unhappily while Niles picks over his potato as if he is dissecting a large insect._

speaker: Martin
text: Sometimes there's nothing like a good steak.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wish this was one of those times.

speaker: Martin
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't mean to complain, but...

speaker: Martin
text: Well, then don't!  For your information, these steaks come from prized beef raised at... [_to Niles_] What the hell are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: [_still dissecting_] Something seems to have fallen in my potato.

speaker: Martin
text: Those are _bacon bits_!

speaker: Niles
text: But I didn't ask for them.

speaker: Martin
text: I ordered all the 'fixins.  You got all the 'fixins.

speaker: Niles
text: But I don't eat bacon because of the nitrates.

speaker: Martin
text: No problem.  They're artificial.  They're made out of soy.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] They really look out for your health here, don't they?

speaker: Martin
text: [_annoyed_] Everybody in this restaurant's enjoying the dinner.  Can't you guys do the same?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm-hmm?

speaker: Frasier
text: Is Maris organizing the... [_smiles to himself_] Arts Council benefit again, this year?

speaker: Niles
text: [_also smiling_] Matter of fact, she is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Where are they holding it?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, they haven't picked a spot yet... perhaps I should tell them about this place!

speaker: Niles
text: I'd like to be a fly on the wall that night!

speaker: Frasier
text: You wouldn't be the only one!  _Frasier and Niles laugh hysterically.  Martin finally runs out of patience._

speaker: Martin
text: Alright, that's it. [_throws his napkin down on the table_] I've had enough of you two jack-asses.  I've spent the whole night listening to you making cracks about the food and the help.  Well, I got news for you: people like this place.  I like this place.  And when you insult this restaurant, you insult me. [_stands up_] You know, I used to think you two took after your mother, liking the ballet and all that, but your mother liked a good ball game too.  She even had a hot dog once in a while. [_reaches into his pocket_] She may have had fancy tastes, but she had too much class to ever make me or anybody else feel second-rate. [_dumps some money onto the table_] If she saw the way you two have behaved tonight, she'd be ashamed. I know I am.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, wait!

speaker: Martin
text: No, I'm going over to Duke's for a night-cap.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, at least let us take you there!

speaker: Martin
text: [_turns around_] I'll take the cab!  I've had enough of you two for one night.  Leave the waitress a good tip.  She deserves it. [_turns back to the door_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, say something!

speaker: Niles
text: [_gets up_] Dad, wait...

speaker: Niles
text: ...the Mud Pie's coming!  _But Martin has left.  Frasier and Niles walk, slowly, back to their table._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_mocking_] "The Mud Pie's coming!"  I feel terrible.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, so do I...

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, the sad thing is, he's right about us.

speaker: Niles
text: Have we really become such snobs?

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't see anybody else driving their father out into the street to drink, do you?  _The waitress arrives to remove Martin's plate.  She gives them a withering stare and whisks the plate away without a word. They are both mortified._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, we... we've gotta apologize to dad.

speaker: Niles
text: You're right.

speaker: Frasier
text: We'll give him a couple of hours to cool down over at Duke's, and then when he gets home, we'll, we'll settle this thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely.  We've been just horrid. [_glances at his plate_] Frasier... do you think we've actually lost the ability to appreciate the simple things?  Steak, potatoes... �fixins?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm afraid so. [_gestures at his plate_] Well you know, the thing is, this-this is, this is good food!  I mean, it's not too fancy but it's, it's, it's good, wholesome American fare!

speaker: Niles
text: You know Frasier, as a tribute to dad, I think we should sit here until we have cleaned our plates.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm game if you are!

speaker: Frasier
text: Going to prove that we are not snobs.

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely.  _Niles, however, cannot bring himself to eat his baked potato. He hatches a plan to dispose of it._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?

speaker: Niles
text: [_gazing over Frasier's shoulder_] Look who's here.  _Frasier turns around in his chair.  While he is looking away, Niles takes his potato off his plate and tries to wrap it up in the napkin on his lap.  Frasier turns back, sees what Niles is up to, and gives him a disapproving stare.  Niles looks up, notices the stare, and sheepishly returns the potato to his plate._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gesturing at Niles_] Eat your meal!
